io.afero.sdk.device

Class DeviceCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.afero.sdk.device.DeviceCollection

  • public class DeviceCollection
extends Object
    The DeviceCollection class manages the collection of DeviceModels associated with the active AferoClient account. This includes adding and removing DeviceModels as well as propogating state change events that originate from the DeviceEventSource.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructs a DeviceCollection.

      Constructs a DeviceCollection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DeviceCollection

        public DeviceCollection(DeviceEventSource deviceEventSource,
                        AferoClient aferoClient)
        Constructs a DeviceCollection. The contents of the collection are managed dynamically in response to messages received from the specified deviceEventSource.
        Parameters:
        deviceEventSource - DeviceEventSource to which the DeviceCollection subscribes for all device messages
        aferoClient - The AferoClient used by the DeviceCollection to associate and disassociate devices with the active account

      • DeviceCollection

        public DeviceCollection(AferoClient aferoClient,
                        String clientId)
        Constructs a DeviceCollection. The contents of the collection are managed dynamically in response to messages received from the specified deviceEventSource. This is a convenience constructor that creates a default ConclaveDeviceEventSource.
        Parameters:
        aferoClient - The AferoClient used by the DeviceCollection to associate and disassociate devices with the active account
        clientId - Unique identifier (uuid) for the calling client app

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public Observable<DeviceCollection> start()
        Starts DeviceCollection operations. When the Observable returned from start completes the DeviceCollection will contain all the DeviceModels associated with the active account.
        Returns:
        Observable that returns this DeviceCollection instance.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops all DeviceCollection operations. When stop completes the DeviceCollection will be unsubscribed from relevant DeviceEventSource observables.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called before start()

      • addDevice

        public Observable<DeviceModel> addDevice(String associationId,
                                         boolean isOwnershipVerified)
        Adds the device specified by the association id to the AferoClient active account. Should initially be called with isOwnershipVerified set to false. If TransferVerificationRequired error is returned, the user should be prompted whether to transfer onwership of the device from its current account. If user answers affirmatively, addDevice should be called again with isOwnershipVerified set to true to complete the ownership transfer.
        Parameters:
        associationId - The association id representing the physical device, usually obtained either via QR code scan or manual entry.
        isOwnershipVerified - Set to true to transfer eligible devices from their current owner account.
        Returns:
        Observable that returns the newly added DeviceModel or an error. If TransferVerificationRequired error is returned, user should be prompted whether to take ownership of device. If user answers affirmatively, addDevice should be called again with isOwnershipVerified set to true.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called before start()

      • removeDevice

        public Observable<DeviceModel> removeDevice(DeviceModel deviceModel)
        Removes the device specified by the association id from the AferoClient active account.
        Parameters:
        deviceModel - The DeviceModel to be removed from the AferoClient active account.
        Returns:
        Observable that returns the removed DeviceModel or an error.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if called before start()

      • getDevices

        public Observable<DeviceModel> getDevices()
        Returns:
        Observable containing a snapshot of all devices in the DeviceCollection

      • getDevice

        public DeviceModel getDevice(String deviceId)
        Parameters:
        deviceId - Identifier of a DeviceModel.
        Returns:
        the DeviceModel with the specified deviceId, or null if no such DeviceModel exists.

      • observeCreates

        public Observable<DeviceModel> observeCreates()
        Returns:
        Observable that emits DeviceModels as they are created and added to the collection either as the result of events from DeviceEventSource or a call to addDevice(String, boolean).

      • observeUpdates

        public Observable<DeviceModel> observeUpdates()
        Returns:
        Observable that emits when an existing DeviceModel is updated.

      • observeDeletes

        public Observable<DeviceModel> observeDeletes()
        Returns:
        Observable that emits DeviceModels as they are removed from the collection either as the result of events from DeviceEventSource or a call to removeDevice(DeviceModel).

      • observeProfileChanges

        public Observable<DeviceModel> observeProfileChanges()
        Returns:
        Observable that emits DeviceModels that have received a new DeviceProfile

      • observeSnapshots

        public Observable<DeviceCollection> observeSnapshots()
        Returns:
        Observable that emits the DeviceCollection whenever a new "snapshot" of devices has been processed.

      • getCount

        public int getCount()
        Returns:
        The current count of DeviceModels in the collection.

      • getDeviceEventSource

        public DeviceEventSource getDeviceEventSource()
        Returns:
        The DeviceEventSource to which the DeviceCollection is subscribed.

      • isStarted

        public boolean isStarted()
        Returns:
        true is start() has completed successfully.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Removes all DeviceModels from the local cache. Typically done when signing out or switching active accounts.
